Pre-Game Insights: India and Sri Lanka played out a thrilling tie in the first ODI of the series where spinners from both teams dominated.
Despite being heavy favourites against Sri Lanka, Team India struggled on the tricky Colombo wicket.
The Indian batting saw Rohit Sharma perform but the likes of Virat Kohli, Shubhman Gill and others got starts but failed to convert them into big knocks.
On the bowling front, the pacers struggled but Kuldeep Yadav, Axar Patel and Washington Sundar dominated in the Lankan spin-friendly conditions.
Sri Lanka has recovered well after a poor T20I series with multiple players stepping up.
The Lankan batting was carried by Pathum Nissanka and an enterprising Dunith Wellalage, who performed well with the ball as well.
The Lankans need Kusal Mendis, Sadeera Samarawickrama and Charith Asalanka to score consistently.
Without Maheesh Theekshana and Matheesha Pathirana, Wellalage, Akila Dananjaya, and Wanindu Hasaranga stepped up with the captain Charith Asalanka even picking up a 3-fer.
